text: <@U25PYL3Q8> tailwind is a utility first css framework. it can create a lot of classes so purgecss is a necessary build step.
understood here. thanks for the more info

<@UKQP9KM8A> The modules are actually html files and I usually directly write markup in there as opposed to doing things programmatically (although sometimes it is necessary), but I think it should mostly work. I'm pretty comfortable whitelisting things in other front end frameworks. My main concern with this question was just trying to find a way to make local dev quicker, but it looks like I'll have to keep plugging away like I am right now.
